poem:
"Resilience, Bound in Rain"

California, steeped in storm-born grief,
Heavy curtain of rain unveiled, brief.
Shattered records; a tale of torment,
Hillsides hum an echoing lament.

Yet, the sun's kiss arrives, slow, tender,
All earthly wounds it yearns to mend,
Teasing hope from the hardest Wednesday,
In each drop, sorrow's disarray ends.

So let go, feel the growth beneath, 
Strength is born from gritted teeth.
